definitions.definition: To eat quickly, greedily , hungrily , or ravenously .
To rapidly destroy , engulf , or lay waste .
examples: The fire was devouring the building.

definitions.definition: To take in avidly with the intellect or with one's gaze .
examples: She intended to devour the book.

definitions.definition: To absorb or engross the mind fully, especially in a destructive manner.
examples: After the death of his wife, he was devoured by grief.

definitions.definition: Synonym of eat : to be very good at something; to slay .
examples: She devoured ! She left no crumbs !
definitions.label_groups: originally drag slang , Internet slang , intransitive

main_definition: ( transitive ) To eat quickly, greedily , hungrily , or ravenously .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , idiomatic ) To rapidly destroy , engulf , or lay waste .
( transitive , idiomatic ) To take in avidly with the intellect or with one's gaze .
( transitive , idiomatic ) To absorb or engross the mind fully, especially in a destructive manner.
( originally drag slang , Internet slang , intransitive ) Synonym of eat : to be very good at something; to slay .
